text: A baby's brain development is influenced by various factors, with overall stimulation playing a key role. Nutrition is only a small part of the equation.
Every baby is different, with individual developmental needs that require personalized care and attention. Even siblings raised together can have distinct developmental paths.
Right-brain stimulation is especially important in the early stages of a child's life. The UpTodd program, backed by research, focuses on activities that support brain development.
Children tend to imitate how their parents or caregivers express emotions, such as anger. It's important to model calmness to positively impact a child's emotional growth.
